title: Saint Cecilia
summary: Saint Cecilia (Latin: Sancta Caecilia) was a Roman martyr venerated in Catholic, Orthodox, Anglican, and some Lutheran churches, such as the Church of Sweden.[2] She became the patroness of music and musicians, it being written that, as the musicians played at her wedding, Cecilia "sang in her heart to the Lord".[3][4]  Musical compositions are dedicated to her, and her feast, on 22 November,[5] is the occasion of concerts and musical festivals.
